headache relief|what to do for headache
responses: For headaches, try resting in a quiet, dark room and stay hydrated. Over-the-counter pain relievers may help, but consult a doctor if severe or persistent.
Headaches can be caused by stress, dehydration, or tension. Try applying a cold compress and getting adequate rest. If it continues, please see a healthcare provider.
I'm sorry you're experiencing head pain. Consider drinking water, taking a break from screens, and gentle neck stretches. Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen.
Headaches are common but shouldn't be ignored if frequent. Rest, hydration, and stress management often help. Consult a doctor for recurring issues.

patterns: i have a fever|running a fever|high temperature
what to do for fever|fever treatment|reduce fever
body temperature is high|feeling hot|burning up
responses: For fever, rest and drink plenty of fluids. You can take acetaminophen or ibuprofen as directed. Seek medical care if fever exceeds 103°F (39.4°C) or persists.
Fever indicates your body is fighting infection. Stay hydrated, rest, and consider fever-reducing medication. Contact a doctor if concerned or if fever is very high.
Monitor your fever and stay comfortable. Lukewarm baths and light clothing can help. Seek immediate medical attention if fever is accompanied by severe symptoms.
Fever management includes rest, fluids, and appropriate medication. Please consult healthcare professionals if fever persists over 3 days or reaches dangerous levels.

patterns: i have a cold|cold symptoms|runny nose
flu symptoms|i have the flu|feeling sick
responses: For cold/flu symptoms, get plenty of rest, stay hydrated, and consider warm salt water gargles for sore throat. Most symptoms resolve in 7-10 days.
Common cold and flu symptoms can be managed with rest, fluids, and over-the-counter medications. See a doctor if symptoms worsen or persist beyond 10 days.
I understand you're not feeling well. Warm liquids, throat lozenges, and adequate sleep can help. Seek medical care if you develop high fever or difficulty breathing.
Cold and flu recovery takes time. Focus on rest, nutrition, and staying hydrated. Contact healthcare providers if symptoms become severe or concerning.
For stomach discomfort, try eating bland foods like toast or crackers, stay hydrated with small sips of water, and avoid spicy or fatty foods. Seek medical attention if severe.
Stomach pain can have various causes. Try resting, applying gentle heat, and eating light foods. If pain is severe, persistent, or accompanied by fever, see a doctor.
I'm sorry you're experiencing stomach issues. Consider the BRAT diet (bananas, rice, applesauce, toast) and clear fluids. Medical evaluation may be needed for severe symptoms.
Digestive discomfort is common but shouldn't be ignored if severe. Rest, gentle foods, and avoiding irritants often help. Consult healthcare providers for persistent issues.
